articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians have waited for two days at roadblocks.
articles.title: Hamas to release Israeli hostage Yehud, two others before Friday, Israel to allow Gazans to return home north

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rwandan-backed rebels marched into the centre of east Congo's largest city, witnesses said, in the latest escalation of decades of conflict in a region already suffering one of the world's worst humanitarian crises.
articles.title: Congo rebels reach centre of eastern city in major escalation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinian refugees in Israeli-occupied East Jerusalem were set to lose education, healthcare and other services provided by U.N. agency UNRWA as an Israeli ban on the organisation takes effect on Thursday.
articles.title: UN agency for Palestinians readies to shutter operations in East Jerusalem after Israeli ban

articles.author: Oliver Griffin, Luis Jaime Acosta, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Colombia's President Gustavo Petro averted an economic disaster at the 11th hour after diplomats from his government and the U.S. reached a deal on deportation flights, but the Colombian business community on Monday called for cooler heads to prevail as Colombians bemoaned canceled U.S. visa appointments.
articles.title: Colombia avoids trade war with US as business community, citizens call for cooler heads

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will soon sign executive orders removing diversity, equity and inclusion from the military, reinstating thousands of troops who were kicked out for refusing COVID-19 vaccines during the pandemic, and building an air defense system for the United States, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump to take aim at DEI, COVID expulsions in military, Hegseth says

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: Britain and the European Union go to court for the first time on Tuesday to resolve a dispute over post-Brexit fishing rights, a case that could complicate Britain's planned "reset" of relations with the bloc.
articles.title: Britain and EU face off in court over post-Brexit fishing rights

articles.author: Ananda Teresia
articles.description: Nearly three decades after the fall of Indonesia's authoritarian leader, General Suharto, the nation's new president is causing unease among liberals and others by increasingly turning to the once-all-powerful military to carry out his governing vision.
articles.title: Indonesia's new leader expands military's role in test of fragile democracy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China is aiming to beef up physical education in schools, making it core to the curriculum rather than a secondary subject, authorities said as they push for a more "holistic education" amid growing concerns about the rise in childhood obesity.
articles.title: China to prioritise physical education in schools as obesity rates rise

articles.author: Barbara Erling, Kuba Stezycki
articles.description: Auschwitz survivors will be joined by world leaders on Monday to mark the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Nazi German death camp by Soviet troops, in what will likely be one of the last such gatherings of those who experienced its horrors.
articles.title: Auschwitz survivors to mark 80th anniversary of camp's liberation

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Nandita Bose, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump stressed the importance of India buying more American-made security equipment and moving toward a fair bilateral trading relationship in a phone call with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday, the White House said.
articles.title: Trump emphasizes 'fair' trade, discusses defense buys and immigration with Modi
